free_text.Learning outcomes: [br/][li]Understanding the benefits and concerns of different types of hydropower plants[br/][li]Understanding the functioning and the basis of the design of hydropower plants[br/][li]Focus will be on pumped storage power plants
free_text.Content: [br/][li]General[br/][][][][]- Benefits and concerns of large hydropower plants[br/][][][][]- Assessment of hydropower potential[br/][][][][]- Sustainable development and hydropower[br/][][][][]- Role of hydropower in the energy mix with other power plants[br/][br/][li]Civil engineering structures and general design[br/][][][][]- Types of hydropower plants and its elements (reservoirs and dams, intakes, open channels, free surface tunnels and pressure tunnels and shafts, free surface and underground powerhouses, mechanical and electrical equipment[br/][][][][]- Layout and design criteria of run-off river plants, high-head power plants with reservoirs and pumped storage power plants[br/][][][][]- Theoretical bases for the design of the main hydraulic structures[br/][][][][]- Refurbishing and upgrading of existing hydropower plants, Particularities of small hydropower plants[br/][][][][]- Economical and environmental criteria of hydropower plants[br/][br/][li]Hydraulic turbines, storage pumps and pump-turbines[br/][][][][]- Momentum transfer in an hydraulic turbine or a pump, classification of hydraulic turbomachines[br/][][][][]- Machine design criteria for either new projects or rehabilitations, flow analysis[br/][][][][]- Hydraulic performance validation, scale model and field tests, efficiency, cavitation, operation stability[br/][][][][]- Cavitation in Francis, Kaplan and Propeller Turbines, cavitation in pumps[br/][][][][]- Transient in hydraulic machines, rotor-stator interactions, hydrodynamics instabilities, hydro-acoustics[br/][br/][li]Electrical equipment[br/][br/][][][][]- Procedure of starting up of pump-turbines in the pumping mode[br/][][][][]- Techniques of machines with variable speed VARSPEED[br/][][][][]- Numerical simulation of transient phenomena
free_text.Form of examination: Oral exam, oral presentation and term paper
